thread.section_title: Latest business and finance news from New Zealand and the world's key markets - Yahoo New Zealand Finance
thread.title: Govt proposal disappoints crowdfund body

title: Govt proposal disappoints crowdfund body
text:
Tue, Aug 4, 2015, 5:51 PM NZST - New Zealand Markets closed Govt proposal disappoints crowdfund body AAP – 16 minutes ago Print 
The federal government's draft framework to expand Australian companies' access to equity crowdfunding falls short of that hoped for by proponents of the funding model. 
Proposals released by Treasury on Tuesday include increasing how much companies are allowed to raise through crowdfunding to $5 million but leave open the question of how to increase access for proprietary companies, which are limited to 50 non-employee shareholders and cannot engage in any capital raising that requires a disclosure document. 
Matt Pinter, head of the Crowd Funding Institute of Australia, said a regime based on public companies made little sense given equity crowdfunding is designed to foster innovation and boost small businesses. 
"The major disappointment is the proprietary structure being essentially parked. That doesn't make sense because nearly all companies start as a proprietary structure," said Mr Pinter. 
Submissions in response to the draft framework close on August 31. @YahooNZBusiness on Twitter, become a fan on Facebook Fairfax finally sells Melbourne print site AAP 
Fairfax Media has sold its printing site near Melbourne Airport to a luxury car dealer for $16 million. The Tullamarine …
